decision_conditions: The proposed rear dormer would, by reason of its scale and size result in a form of development that would dominate the original roof and appear visually intrusive, harming the character and appearance of the dwelling house and surrounding area, contrary to Policy 26 of the Havering Local Plan (adopted 2021) and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (2011).

The proposed single storey rear extension would, by reason of its depth, height and position close to the south-east shared boundary, would lead to an overbearing and unduly prominent form of development that would harm the amenity of the neighbouring occupiers at No.19 Erroll Road, contrary to Policy 7 of the Havering Local Plan (adopted 2021) and the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (2011).

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, improvements required to make the proposal acceptable were negotiated with the applicant/agent via email on 24/06/2025. The revisions to the rear dormer resulted in further need for amendments. The applicant declined to make the suggested revisions.
description: Erection of a single storey rear extension, first floor side extension, conversion of garage to habitable use and a loft conversion involving an installation of a rear dormer and roof lights to front
